item.title: Connection to Server Refused
item.description: When you see similar error as below: 1user@example:~$ kubectl get nodes 2The connection to the server localhost:8080 was refused - did you specify the right host or port? Check for the "$KUBECONFIG" if set and "kubectl config view" output. Chances are, both are empty like below: 1user@example:~$ echo $KUBECONFIG 1user@example:~$ kubectl config view 2apiVersion: v1 3clusters: null 4contexts: null 5current-context: "" 6kind: Config 7preferences: {} 8users: null In this example, we're using the DOKS or DigitalOcean Managed Kubernetes.
